poem:
### Crisis Engendered

In the steel corridors of power,
echoes of footsteps falter, 
as leaders clutch at shadows,
bearing weights unseen.

Loneliness in the mantle,
a familiar, graven friend.

Crisis births crisis—
a relentless lineage,
coursing through veins of a nation,
writhing for release.
